abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the outcome of the project
            objectives was satisfactory. The sustainability of the
            project is rated as likely in both financial and
            institutional terms. Overall, the World Bank's
            performance was satisfactory during project preparation,
            appraisal, and implementation. There was excellent
            coordination between the project team and all relevant
            sector and operation units. Similarly, the overall
            performance of the Borrower was satisfactory. There were
            several lessons learned, both institutional as well as
            technical. They included: Minimizing effectiveness delays by
            obtaining all clearnaces in advance will be critical for
            future projects. putting health on the local political
            agenda through decentralization is critical for sustained
            delivery of health care to the slum populations. Long term
            engagement is needed both for building capacities of local
            municipalities and sensitizing slum communities for
            effective delivery of health services and their use by the
            urban poor. Factors that enhance the health access and
            demand include neighborhood female community volunteers and
            local leaders acting as catalysts; using private
            practitioners; and client friendly services provided at
            convenient locations and times. cost sharing with
            safeguards, retention of user fees, flexibility based on
            local needs and capacities, involvement of departments
            implementing urbna poverty reduction programs, development
            of permanent infrastructure, and partnerships with NGO and
            private are noted. Technical lessons comprised judiciously
            mixing public health and curative care services; ensuring
            good referral linkages, especially for emergency obstetric
            care; and attending to the reproductive health needs of
            males. Operational lessons focused on starting services
            early on and initiating demand generation actvities;
            prioritizing behavior change initiatives to a focused set of
            interventions and strategic delivery of messages based on
            sound communiciations research; and better coordinating
            health interventions with ongoing slum development programs.
